quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nickname and World Series
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athletics, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which World Series did the New York Yankees become world champions led by Mantle and Berra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1958

questions.question: Carlton Fisk was best known by what nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pudge

questions.question: What was the nickname of Walter Johnson, one of the top pitchers of his era?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Train

questions.question: When did the Oakland Athletics win their first of three consecutive World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972

questions.question: His name is Lawrence Peter Berra but most people know him by this nickname.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi

questions.question: Reginald Martinez Jackson, who started his career with the As, earned what nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. October

questions.question: The Pittsburgh Pirates, nicknamed The Bucs, won  which World Series in the 1970s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1979

questions.question: What was Mordecai Browns nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Fingers

questions.question: When did the Pittsburgh Pirates win the World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1960

questions.question: The Milwaukee Braves won the World Series in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1957

questions.question: Carl Michael Yastrzemski, who played his entire career with the Boston Red Sox, was best known for what nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yaz

questions.question: The Detroit Tigers won the World Series in which of the following years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1984

questions.question: Guess the nickname of Ty Cobb, who Won the Triple Crown in 1909.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Georgia Peach

questions.question: Guess the nickname of Henry Louis Gehrig.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Iron Horse

questions.question: The Cincinnati Reds, a Major League Baseball, became World Champions in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1975

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Position and Nascar
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, phillies, nextel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Racing driver Jeff Gordon failed to qualify for Chase for the Nextel Cup in 2005.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which auto racing driver became the 2005 Nextel Cup Champion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Stewart

questions.question: Brooks Robinson was considered the human vacuum cleaner at his position.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Base

questions.question: This NASCAR Nextel Cup Series and Busch Series driver won the 2005 Golden Corral 500.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Edwards

questions.question: Mike Schmidt starred with the Phillies at what position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Base

questions.question: When did the New York Giants win the World Series over the Cleveland Indians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1954

questions.question: When did the Los Angeles Dodgers win the fall classic led by Fernando Valenzuela?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981

questions.question: Hammerin Hank Aaron primarily played which of these positions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Right Field

questions.question: Dale Earnhardt Jr., the son of NASCAR legend Dale Earnhardt, had how many wins in the 2005 NASCAR season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: While playing with different teams throughout his career, Eddie Murray was great at what position mostly with the Orioles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Base

questions.question: This professional NASCAR driver, winner of the 1989 Winston Cup Championship, retired after the 2005 NASCAR Nextel Cup season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rusty Wallace

questions.question: George Herman Ruth, better known as the Babe, usually played this position.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Right Field

questions.question: When did The New York Mets win their first World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1969

questions.question: Joe Morgan became an instant star when he was traded to the Reds. What was his position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second Base

questions.question: Probably the greatest player of all time at his position, Johnny Bench was elected to the Hall of Fame in 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catcher

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Hall and Baseman
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athletics, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Hall of Fame first baseman played for the Chicago Cubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Chance

questions.question: This Hall of Famer played for The Philadelphia Athletics from 1925 to 1935.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmie Foxx

questions.question: Which of these Hall of Famers played first base for the Detroit Tigers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Greenberg

questions.question: This power hitting Hall of Famer played at first base primarily with the San Francisco Giants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie McCovey

questions.question: This Hall of Famer played primarily for the Baltimore Orioles at first base.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Murray

questions.question: Kansas City Royalss player George Brett starred at this position.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Base

questions.question: This player was the Hall of Fame first baseman for the Minnesota Twins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harmon Killebrew

questions.question: Golf originated in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scotland

questions.question: Roy Campanella starred for the Brooklyn Dodgers during the 1950s at which position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catcher

questions.question: One of these is an unusual hazard on the golf course.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice

questions.question: Which Hall of Famer played first base with the Cincinnati Reds?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Perez

questions.question: While starting his career with the Red Sox, it was with the Yankees that Wade Boggs won the World Series. Where did you usually see Wade play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Base

questions.question: This first baseman, member of the Hall of Fame, was a main cog of the New York Yankees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Gehrig

questions.question: This Hall of Fame first baseman played with the New York Giants from 1923 to 1936 and was their manager in the period 1932-1941.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Terry

questions.question: Which of these Hall of Famers was first baseman for the San Francisco Giants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orlando Cepeda

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Players and Par
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, atlanta, phillies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In June 1964 the St. Louis Cardinals traded Bobby Shantz, Ernie Broglio and Doug Clemens to the Chicago Cubs for which future Hall of Famer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Brock

questions.question: It is widely known that the New York Mets traded Tom Seaver on June 15, 1977. Who else did the Mets trade that same day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Kingman

questions.question: A handicap is a numerical measure of an amateur golfers ability.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: After the 1981 season, the St. Louis Cardinals and the San Diego Padres swapped which shortstops?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzie Smith and Garry Templeton

questions.question: Legendary slugger Babe Ruth was once traded by the Boston Red Sox to the New York Yankees for Charley Root.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Par is the theoretical number of strokes that an expert golfer should require for playing the ball into any given hole. If the distance from the starting position to the hole is 225 m - 434 m, then the par is this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: The 19th hole is the colloquial term for the platform where golf players receive their awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Pete Rose was traded once in his career for which of these players?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Lawless

questions.question: The Atlanta Braves traded Doyle Alexander to the Detroit Tigers on August 12, 1987, for which player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Smoltz

questions.question: Can players change their balls during the game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The New York Yankees got pitcher Bob Sykes in return for this two time batting champion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie McGee

questions.question: The putting green refers to this.

options.text: The area where the ball is first hit (starting position)
The area around water hazards like ponds, lakes, etc.
The area around the actual hole

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The area around the actual hole

questions.question: The Legend of Bagger Vance (2000) is a popular Hollywood production, depicting the story of a fictional golf player who had lost his swing and found it again. Who played his role?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matt Damon

questions.question: This southpaw was traded by the Yankees for Roger Clemens.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Wells

questions.question: The Philadelphia Phillies gave up on this Hall of Famer after just 13 games, trading him to the Chicago Cubs for Ivan DeJesus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ryne Sandberg

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Career and Plate
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Former UCLA and Rams lineman Woody Strode fought a brief but memorable arena battle as a gladiator in what famous movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spartacus

questions.question: Before he nailed down his macho movie career, this African-American actor was known on the gridiron as The Hammer. He played for the Oakland Raiders, then for the Kansas City Chiefs in the first-ever Super Bowl.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Williamson

questions.question: Baseball player Hank Aaron only swung the bat from the right side of the plate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What are the common links connecting the Boston Red Sox, the film Capote and the TV series Homicide?

options.text: The movie and TV show included major scenes in Fenway Park.
The movie and show were produced by Ted Williams nephew.
The sister of a Red Sox executive produced Homicide, and her husband wrote Capote.
Truman Capote looked divine in red.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The sister of a Red Sox executive produced Homicide, and her husband wrote Capote.

questions.question: Which popular author and screenwriter is also widely known as a devoted Red Sox fan and has co-written a book entitled Faithful: Two Diehard Boston Red Sox Fans Chronicle the Historic 2004 Season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen King

questions.question: After reigning as the world light-heavyweight boxing champion from 1932-34, this pugilist proceeded to transform himself  into one of the first and most successful athletes-turned-actors in Hollywood history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maxie Rosenbloom

questions.question: Which of these real-life jockeys, chosen as one of People Magazines 50 Most Beautiful People in 2003, played another real-life jockey in Seabiscuit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Stevens

questions.question: This box-office heavyweight has portrayed numerous athlete-heroes in his movie career, but in real life his favorite competitive sport is auto racing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Newman

questions.question: Pete Rose only batted from the left side of the plate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: First baseman Eddie Murray was a switch hitter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Babe Ruth was a switch hitter early in his career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which leading man in a popular TV Western series briefly played both professional baseball and basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Connors

questions.question: Before he won the world welterweight boxing championship, and long before he had any acting experience, Brooklyns Mark Breland was tapped to debut in this military-school drama.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lords of Discipline

questions.question: Among Hollywoods athletic box-office stars, this Florida boy probably boasts the most accomplished college-football career of any major movie star.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burt Reynolds

questions.question: After the 1974 season, the Milwaukee Brewers traded Dave May and Roger Alexander for this slugger.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Aaron

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Kentucky Derby and Plate
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, racetrack, gold. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Willie Mays was a right-handed batter only while he played in the big leagues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these teams does not have the color blue in their logo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlanta Falcons

questions.question: The Kentucky Derby takes place yearly in Louisville, on which day?

options.text: Any day chosen by the owners

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Saturday in May

questions.question: Maury Wills was a right-handed hitter only for the Dodgers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What other name was given to the Kentucky Derby?

options.text: The Fastest Two Minutes in Sport

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Run for the Roses

questions.question: How many horses are allowed to run in the Kentucky Derby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 20

questions.question: Thirteen-time Gold Glove Award winner Ozzie Smith batted from the left side of the plate only.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The thoroughbred horses that run at the Kentucky Derby must be at what age?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three years old

questions.question: The Kentucky Derby is held at which racetrack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Churchill Downs

questions.question: Former baseball player Johnny Bench was a switch hitter in the minor leagues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Major League Baseball player Chipper Jones bats both left-handed and right-handed from the plate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the distance, covered by the Kentucky Derby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mile and one quarter

questions.question: The award for the top pitcher in each of the two major leagues is named after which Hall of Fame pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cy Young

questions.question: Mickey Mantle was considered the most powerful switch hitter of his generation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Fillies are not allowed to run in the Kentucky Derby.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
